settings.title: A Celebration of Heritage, Reimagined for Today’s World
settings.main_information_text:
With ROOTED, KALKI takes you on a journey back to where it all began—celebrating our deep cultural heritage, rich in tradition and craftsmanship. This collection is an ode to the timeless beauty of global prints, seamlessly blending traditional techniques like block print, kalamkari, ajrakh, and beyond.

At the heart of ROOTED is the belief that true style is deeply connected to one's origins. It’s not just fashion—it’s a way to wear your heritage proudly, with prints and patterns that tell stories of culture, craft, and community. ROOTED offers designs that speak to the soul and celebrate the authenticity of being deeply grounded in tradition.

settings.blogs_title: Men’s Kurta Color Trends For The Upcoming Festive Season
Rich Tapestry Of Tradition & Innovation: Block Print Kurtas For Men
The Rise Of Men’s Kurta In Western Fashion

settings.main_information_text:
Embrace the Beauty of Block Print Indian Clothing

Skilled Indian craftsmen have mastered the centuries-old tradition of block printing since the 12th century. While some believe this art was borrowed from China, our local artisans added their inputs over time in the form of newer colours and patterns. Though the process of hand block printing has been replaced with faster screen printing, you will still find Indigenous workshops upholding this cultural tradition. A lot of love and labour goes into the process of block printing to present the finest hand block print kurta set. The designs of block prints can range from paisley motifs to geometric patterns and more. This is the reason behind its rhetoric popularity in menswear fashion. You can trust a handblock kurta to deliver the right blend of our rich Indian heritage and modern fashion to your wardrobe. You can choose a yellow block print kurta to arrive in style at the Haldi festivities of your Veere or slay at your housewarming puja in a blue block print kurta. The best thing about this trend in mens ethnic wear is its high level of versatility, which can let you be stylish without forgetting your roots.

What's Special About Block Printing?

Block print kurta for men is made by stamping wooden blocks on fabric. It starts with skilled wood carvers carving the outline block in a tedious process. While simple designs require three blocks, the craftsmen might need around 30 blocks to create detailed patterns on a block print kurta set. These blocks are dipped in colours either fully or partially to create beautiful patterns on a handblock print kurta. The fabric also undergoes washing and drying before being stamped with the most aesthetic prints by master craftsmen. When choosing the colours for block prints, some prefer vegetable dyes, which render the brightest shades, whereas others stick to easy-to-mix pigment dyes. The placement of handblocks also has a vital role in elevating the visuals of the block print kurta for men.

Types of Block Printed Men's Clothing

Step out in style wearing a block-print kurta for men. These versatile clothing pieces can help you transition from day to night, whether you have an ethnic day at college or are hanging out with friends. A sherwani for men is a preferred choice during wedding festivities, and you can nail ethnic fashion like a pro wearing the trendiest traditional Indian mens clothes featuring block prints. You can’t go wrong in a block-printed kurta jacket set for men that can effortlessly amp up your fashion game.
